content: to figure out when to start the toe know that the toe has 24 rounds divide by your stockinette row gauge and that is how long the toe will be for example my row gauge is 10 so my toe will measure 2 4 toe cut cc using mc knit 1 round if necessary knit additional rounds to achieve the correct foot length before toe decreases begin then repeat the following two rounds until 30 total stitches remain round 1 k all sts round 2 decrease round k1 ssk k to 3 sts before the end of the instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before bor k2tog k1 work the decrease round once more so that 26 stitches remain graft the toe using kitchener stitch you can eliminate ears by treating the 2nd and 3rd stitches from each end as a single stitch when grafting so when you knit on or knit off you pass the needle through both stitches as if working a k2tog and when you purl on or purl off you pass the needle through both stitches as if working a p2tog this might be a little fiddly but it has the effect of continuing the decrease pattern while grafting finishing weave in all ends now do it all over again for the second sock don t forget to start the chart on row 13 for the second sock if you re knitting the small or large size circuit socks v1 0 - cow from mars - 5
